sentences.english: It is characterized by containing concave and convex rod stone powder in said paste.
sentences.chinese: 其特徵是漿糊中含有凹凸棒石粉末。

sentences.english: He sealed the envelope with paste.
I tasted the paste in haste and cast it on the waste plaster.
sentences.chinese: 我匆倉促品味了漿糊然後將其丟在廢泥灰上。

sentences.english: The big investment banks were the ultimate confusopolies.
sentences.chinese: 大的投資銀行都是一腦子漿糊。

sentences.english: Look , the paste has crusted on your sleeve .
sentences.chinese: 瞧，漿糊都嘎巴在你袖子上了。

sentences.english: So are you saying that right-wing people are mostly thick?
sentences.chinese: 所以你是說大部分右翼都是漿糊腦袋？

sentences.english: Cut and paste techniques are used as labor-saving aids.
sentences.chinese: 削減和漿糊技術被當作解救勞動的幫助使用。

sentences.english: There is no paste on the tablets of the leftovers with the stars stick to the surface of the silk has been.
sentences.chinese: 沒有漿糊，就用剩飯粒把星星粘到了紅綢被面上。

sentences.english: When the paste is scraped off and the cloth gets thoroughly dried, the material is ready for painting.
sentences.chinese: 颳去漿糊以後，布乾透了，就可以開始畫了。

sentences.english: The use of exhaust paste before the catalytic converter can also cause the monolith to break .
sentences.chinese: 在催化裂化爐前使用廢氣漿糊也會引起塑膠製品破裂。

sentences.english: A man’s insides were turned into soup by a horse.
sentences.chinese: 有個傢伙的內臟被一匹馬搗成了漿糊。

sentences.english: When I put wallpaper up I got paste all over my hands and clothes.
sentences.chinese: 我貼牆紙時手上和衣服上全都沾滿了漿糊。

sentences.english: He sticks two pieces of paper with paste.
sentences.chinese: 他把兩張紙用漿糊粘在一起。

sentences.english: Some have referred to it by the unappetizing name "capital jelly ".
sentences.chinese: 某些人把它稱爲“資本漿糊”這一倒胃口的名字。

sentences.english: The present invention provides a kind of flourless paste which can be used as a substitute for paste.
sentences.chinese: 本發明提供一種無糧漿糊供人們代替漿糊使用。

sentences.english: The present invention provides a kind of flourless paste which can be used as a substitute for paste.
sentences.chinese: 本發明提供一種無糧漿糊供人們代替漿糊使用。

definition: to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to split open/to dehisce (of fruit or cotton bolls, to split open)
